H0.text: Observation is what the student wrote in the laboratory notebook, describing that a piece of iron placed in a beaker of water sank to the bottom.

H1.text: Prediction is what the student wrote in the laboratory notebook when noting that a piece of iron placed in a beaker of water sank to the bottom of the beaker.

H2.text: Inference is what the student wrote in the laboratory notebook, describing that a piece of iron placed in a beaker of water sank to the bottom of the beaker.

H3.text: Hypothesis is the example of the studentâ€™s laboratory notebook entry stating that a piece of iron was placed in a beaker of water and sank to the bottom of the beaker.

A4.text: Researchers use a lab notebook to document their hypotheses, experiments and initial analysis or interpretation of these experiments.

A5.text: The lab notebook is usually written as the experiments progress, rather than at a later date.
